description: Keir Starmer promised British voters the Labour Party would put public service at the heart of a “mission-led” government after years of Conservative scandals. Barely two months in, his premiership is mired in awkward stories about political donors, freebies and feuding staff.
title: Keir Starmer Stumbles Into What Should Be His Big Victory Lap

description: In any high-stakes military conflict with China, the US Navy will be critical to winning. But America’s shipbuilding industry is far from able to support what the Navy needs.
title: US Leans on Shipbuilding Prowess of Allies to Compete With China

description: Mali closed down cattle markets across its capital, following a string of deadly attacks by Islamist militants believed to recruit from one ethnic group also linked to the livestock trade.
title: Mali Shuts Cattle Markets in Capital in Bid to Contain Jihadist Threat

description: North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper said the controversy surrounding Lieutenant Governor Mark Robinson could help Vice President Kamala Harris flip his state for Democrats on Election Day.
title: North Carolina Governor Says Robinson Furor Could Benefit Harris

description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission called out Elon Musk over his latest “excuse” to skip questioning in a probe of his 2022 acquisition of Twitter: He was attending a SpaceX rocket launch.
title: SEC Blasts Musk for Attending Rocket Launch Over Twitter Deposition

description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The son of a Mexican drug cartel leader was convicted Friday of charges that he used violence, including the deadly downing of a military helicopter, to help his father operate one of the country's largest and most dangerous narcotics trafficking organizations.
title: Mexican Cartel Leader's Son Is Convicted of Drug Trafficking in US

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Steven T. Dennis looks at embattled House Speaker Mike Johnson’s efforts to avoid a government shutdown.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Congress Puts on Another Shutdown Melodrama Before Likely Deal

description: Vice President Kamala Harris spotlighted the death of a woman in Georgia who was unable to obtain access to a legal abortion, laying the blame on Donald Trump and his role in the US Supreme Court overturning protections for the procedure.
title: Harris Assails Trump Over Georgia Abortion Ban, Woman’s Death

description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy will push US President Joe Biden to provide an official invitation to join NATO and commit to a sustained supply of advanced weapons as part of the Ukrainian president’s “victory plan” to end the war with Russia.
title: Zelenskiy to Push US for NATO Invite, Weapons Guarantees

description: Ghana’s Electoral Commission has approved 13 candidates to run in the gold and cocoa producer’s upcoming presidential election.
title: Ghana Approves 13 Candidates for December’s Presidential Polls

description: US prosecutors subpoenaed Molly Schaeffer, director of New York City’s Office of Asylum Seeker Operations, according to a person familiar with the matter, amid a widening set of investigations that have engulfed Mayor Eric Adams’ administration.
title: NYC Mayor Adams’ Asylum Director Schaeffer Is Subpoenaed by US

description: The international legal team for Hong Kong ex-media mogul Jimmy Lai is urging the US and UK to strike a deal for his release, as the septuagenarian’s trial under a Beijing-imposed security law enters its eleventh hour.
title: Hong Kong Tycoon Lai’s Lawyers Target China Diplomatic Deal

description: Google has monopolized the technology used to buy and sell online display ads by restricting or eliminating the choices of its customers — both website publishers and advertisers — the US Justice Department alleged at a federal antitrust trial.
title: How Google Allegedly Monopolized the Ad Technology Market

description: Georgia’s State Election Board approved a controversial new rule requiring all ballots to be hand-counted at each of the state’s polling sites, just weeks before early voting is scheduled to start in the pivotal swing state.
title: Georgia Risks Election Delay by Approving Hand Counting of Votes

description: Neuberger Berman senior portfolio manager Steve Eisman deleted a social media account and retracted remarks indicating he was “celebrating” the deaths of Palestinians in Gaza.
title: Steve Eisman Deletes X Account After Post ‘Celebrating’ Attack in Gaza

description: Google is set to be hit by another attack from European Union watchdogs, paving the way for a hefty fine and an order to change its business model unless the US giant takes rapid action to give more prominence to rivals across its sprawling search empire.
title: Google Faces EU Ultimatum in Fresh Attack on Search Dominance

description: President Joe Biden reiterated his commitment to try and negotiate a cease-fire between Israel and Hamas following a report that said officials in his administration believe the prospects for brokering such a deal are unlikely during his term.
title: Biden to Keep Pushing Cease-Fire After Report Casts Doubt on Bid

description: The US has asked at least one shipping insurer for information on 14 companies it suspects may have violated sanctions on Russian oil, a sign Western governments are still trying to limit the ways Moscow exports its fuels.
title: US Ups Pressure to Clamp Down on Russian Oil Sanctions Breaches

description: The German government won’t sell any more shares in Commerzbank AG for now, the strongest signal yet that Berlin is opposed to any UniCredit SpA bid.
title: German Government Won’t Sell More Commerzbank Shares for Now

description: The US is seeking a new deal with Iraq that could keep American troops stationed in the country, after Baghdad said they are no longer needed as their original mission to defeat ISIS is complete.
title: US Seeks New Deal With Iraq After Baghdad Says Troops Not Needed

description: The International Monetary Fund is focusing on a set of options to ease the additional debt burden it imposes on nations looking to escape financial distress, as it seeks to address complaints that its current system is overly punitive.
title: IMF Narrowing Options to Ease Loan Penalties by October Meetings

description: Zambian mining companies met with the government to resolve differences over a proposed legal change that would potentially give the state a bigger share of its mineral resources.
title: Zambian Miners Resist State Taking Bigger Stake in Resources

description: Iran is treating scores of people wounded in pager and walkie-talkie explosions in Lebanon that targeted its key ally Hezbollah.
title: Iran Rushes to Treat Lebanese Hurt in Pager Attack on Hezbollah

description: Mexico’s President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said cash injections to state oil company Petroleos Mexicanos should continue after President-Elect Claudia Sheinbaum takes power in October.
title: AMLO Calls for Cash Aid to Mexican Oil Company Pemex to Continue

description: France’s budget deficit could reach 6% of economic output this year without new measures to curb spending or increase tax, Les Echos reported citing new forecasts from the finance ministry.
title: French Deficit Could Reach 6% GDP Without Action, Les Echos Says

description: Keir Starmer’s government needs to combine caution and piecemeal announcements with some optimism about where the country is headed.
title: Labour's Tone Depresses UK Consumers

description: The US Supreme Court refused to order Nevada officials to include Green Party presidential nominee Jill Stein on the November ballot, buttressing Democrat Kamala Harris in a potentially pivotal state.
title: Supreme Court Spurns Green Party on Nevada Ballot, Aiding Harris

description: An Israeli strike on Beirut’s southern suburbs, where Iran-backed Hezbollah has a strong presence, killed eight people and wounded at least 59 others, according to the Lebanese health ministry.
title: Lebanon Says Eight Die in Israeli Airstrike in Beirut Suburb

description: Hungary hosted a Russian business forum in Budapest on Friday, showcasing booming links with Moscow that have alienated the country’s European Union and NATO allies.
title: Hungary Touts Booming Russian Business Links in Standoff With EU

description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is seeking a meeting with Kamala Harris in New York ahead of the UN General Assembly next week, in an early effort to sustain a recent improvement in ties with the US.
title: Turkey’s Erdogan Seeks US Meeting With Harris to Boost Ties

description: Debris from a Russian missile damaged a civilian ship under the flag of Antigua in Ukraine’s Black Sea port of Odesa, according to the regional governor.
title: Russian Missile Debris Damages Civilian Ship  in Ukraine’s Odesa

description: Euro-area countries will struggle to meet the European Union’s revised fiscal framework, according to research from Bloomberg Economics.
title: Most Euro Nations Have Little Chance of Meeting Fiscal Rules

description: Bangladesh’s interim government appealed for calm after at least four people died in clashes between rival groups in the southeastern region bordering India and Myanmar.
title: Bangladesh Calls for Calm After Deadly Clashes in Restive Region

description: Switzerland’s government intends to slash state spending, proposing to parliament cuts worth multiple billions in a radical move to balance a budget that — despite internationally low debt levels — has been running deficits since the Covid pandemic.
title: Switzerland Plans to Save as Much as $5.5 Billion a Year

description: The European Union’s new debt rules aim to be tough enough to spur fiscal rectitude, but not so tough as to be unachievable. Running current financial plans through Bloomberg Economics debt models suggests that neither France, Italy nor Spain are anywhere near complying with the EU’s latest demands. The takeaway: adhering fully to the new regulation is likely to require consolidations that will be extremely difficult to deliver. The new framework is an improvement on the last, but the most strin
title: New EU Fiscal Rules and Old Debts Meet Hard Math

description: Hot, dry conditions have fueled an unusually destructive fire season in Brazil, spiking carbon emissions.
title: Thousands of Fires Are Burning in the Drought-Wracked Amazon

description: Rodent infestations and the closure of a historic hotel add to the list of troubles facing Aramark, the park concessioner.
title: In Yosemite, Problems With Concessions Keep Piling Up

description: Poland will ask the European Commission to adjust its recommendations for budget deficit cuts in the coming years due to rebuilding costs after floods hit the country’s southwest, Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski said.
title: Poland to Seek EU’s Leniency in Deficit Cut Talks After Floods

description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen announced plans for a loan of up to €35 billion ($39.1 billion) backed by the profits from immobilized Russian central bank assets to help provide more predictable financial support to Ukraine.
title: EU Plans New €35 Billion Loan for Ukraine Under G-7 Plan

description: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck floated the idea of additional support for the country’s carmakers and will discuss ways to address the challenges facing the embattled sector in talks with executives on Monday in Berlin.
title: German Minister Dangles Prospect of Additional Aid for Carmakers

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Everything Is Going Wrong All at Once for Germany

description: Commerzbank AG’s labor representatives are “bitterly determined” to prevent a merger with Italian rival UniCredit SpA, warning that two-thirds of the jobs at the German lender could be cut in a takeover.
title: Commerzbank Labor Union ‘Bitterly’ Opposes Any Unicredit Merger

description: The European Union plans to fund a €35 billion ($39.1 billion) loan backed by future profits from immobilized Russian central bank assets to help provide more predictable financial support to Ukraine, the Financial Times reported.
title: EU Plans €35 Billion Loan for Ukraine, Financial Times Reports

description: The central bank’s decision to cut rates seven weeks before the vote has it fielding criticism from both parties.
title: The Fed Risks a Political Backlash by Spurring Economy Close to Election

description: American Battery Technology Co. and lithium-producer Albemarle Corp. are among 25 companies getting more than $3 billion in funding from the Biden administration to boost domestic production of advanced batteries and components.
title: Biden Awards $3 Billion to Boost Domestic Battery Production

description: Israel’s operation against Hezbollah members in Lebanon and Syria through booby-trapped pagers and walkie-talkies was years in the making, and its use now ramped up a high-risk campaign aimed at deeply disrupting the group.
title: Israel Shifts War Focus to Hezbollah Hurt by Pager Blasts

description: A growing number oil tankers that were sanctioned for their role in transporting Russian petroleum are finding work again — a blow to western authorities who sought to clamp down on the vessels in an effort to hurt Moscow’s access to petrodollars.
title: Russia’s Use of Blacklisted Tankers to Move Oil Accelerates

description: The worst floods in decades across a swath of West and Central Africa are deepening a record food-insecurity crisis in a region where the United Nations says 55 million people are already going hungry.
title: Africa Floods Spread Misery Where 55 Million Already Face Hunger

description: Israel carried out extensive air strikes across southern Lebanon on Thursday, stepping up hostilities after it declared a “new phase” of war against militant group Hezbollah in the area.
title: Israel Widens Strikes Against Hezbollah in ‘New Phase’ of War

description: Malaysia’s king is planning to seek funding from Chinese investors for a multibillion dollar high-speed rail project between the Southeast Asian country and Singapore, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Malaysia King to Seek High-Speed Rail Funds on China Visit

description: China and Japan reached a deal that would pave the way for the lifting of Beijing’s ban on Japanese seafood imports, removing a key source of diplomatic friction between the two nations.
title: China, Japan Reach Deal That Would Allow Easing of Seafood Ban

description: Republican nominee Donald Trump told an antisemitism summit that Jewish voters could be to blame if he ultimately lost the presidential election and complained that he had not “been treated right” after his support of Israel.
title: Trump Says Jewish Voters Would Have ‘Lot to Do With a Loss’
